result.execSummary:
The defendant Hunter R. Jordens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Hunter R. Jordens is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Hunter R. Jordens was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 p.m. Defendant Hunter R. Jordens in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Count 1 - Granted. Plea questionaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Bednar/Burns/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees/Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Domestic violence counseling 
No intoxicants, no taverns
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Special disposition under Section 973.015 if successfully completes probation and pays all costs/fees.
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
Adj. 1:39 p.m.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

2:39 P.M. Defendant Hunter R. Jordens in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
No abusive contact with Cathy A. Straveler

02:05 pm - Defendant Hunter R. Jordens in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel.  Bednar statement to bail - Court continues $150 cash bond posted.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
